title: Mechanical Vibration
intent: Improve performance by introducing controlled oscillation, iteration, or repetition instead of static operation.

triz_principle.name: Mechanical Vibration
triz_principle.definition: Cause an object or system to oscillate or repeatedly change state to improve its effectiveness.

problem_understanding.core_contradiction: We want stability, but static operation prevents learning, optimization, and responsiveness.
problem_understanding.why_this_hurts: Without cycles and feedback, systems drift away from reality and degrade silently.
typical_signals: long periods between reviews or releases
decisions made once and never revisited

solution_logic.core_idea: Introduce frequent, controlled cycles that allow adjustment and learning.
solution_logic.key_rule: Oscillate deliberately instead of drifting unconsciously.
solution_logic.how_it_resolves_the_contradiction: The system stays aligned with reality through constant small corrections instead of rare big ones.

consulting: short feedback workshops instead of annual reviews
architecture: rolling upgrades instead of big-bang releases
enterprise_sap: periodic MDG rule tuning based on rejection patterns

diagnostic_questions: Where do we get feedback too late?
Which assumptions should be tested repeatedly?
What cycle frequency would balance learning and stability?

example.before: Data quality rules are defined once and rarely revisited.
example.after: Rules are reviewed and adjusted regularly based on actual rejection and error patterns.
